line.token: * Verifies that block comments are used appropriately.
* Returns an array of tokens this test wants to listen for.
* Processes this test, when one of its tokens is encountered.
* @param PHP_CodeSniffer_File $phpcsFile The current file being scanned.
* @param int $stackPtr The position of the current token in the
// If it's an inline comment, return.
// If this is a function/class/interface doc block comment, skip it.
// We are only interested in inline doc block comments.
// Construct the comment into an array.
// Found the next bit of code.
'Single line block comment not allowed; use inline ("// text") comment instead'
'Block comment text must start on a new line'
// Make sure first line isn't blank.
'Empty line not allowed at start of comment'
'First line of comment not aligned correctly; expected %s but found %s'
'Block comments must start with a capital letter'
// Check that each line of the comment is indented past the star.
// First and last lines (comment opener and closer) are handled separately.
// First comment line was handled above.
'Comment line indented incorrectly; expected at least %s but found %s'
// Finally, test the last line is correct.
'Comment closer must be on a new line'
'Last line of comment aligned incorrectly; expected %s but found %s'
// Check that the lines before and after this comment are blank.
'Empty line not required before block comment'
